title: 2 Easy Ways to Remove Table Formatting in Microsoft Excel

steps.title: Open a project in Microsoft Excel.
steps.content: Open a project in Microsoft Excel. You can use an existing project or create a new spreadsheet . [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Microsoft Excel is available on Windows and Mac . You can also use the online web version at https://www.office.com/ .

steps.title: Highlight the table you want to change.
steps.content: Highlight the table you want to change. Click the top-left corner of the table and drag the cursor to the bottom-right corner. This will select all the cells within the table. If needed, you can create a new table .

steps.title: Click Home.
steps.content: Click Home . You can find this on the top toolbar, next to Insert . You may already be on this tab.

steps.title: Click Format as Table.
steps.content: Click Format as Table . This will be in the Styles section. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Clear.
steps.content: Click Clear . This will be at the bottom of the drop-down menu. On some devices, you can find the Clear icon in the Editing section. This looks like a pink eraser icon. Tap Clear , and then tap Clear Formats . The table's formatting will be removed.

steps.title: Remove the table (optional).
steps.content: Remove the table (optional). If you want to remove the entire table rather than just the style, you can convert the table into a range of data. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Do the following: Highlight the table. Click the Table Design tab. In the "Tools" section, click Convert to Range . Click Yes . The table will be converted.

steps.title: Open a project in the Microsoft Excel app.
steps.content: Open a project in the Microsoft Excel app. The app looks like an x on top of a green rectangle. Microsoft Excel is available on iOS and Android.

steps.title: Highlight the table you want to change.
steps.content: Highlight the table you want to change. Tap the cell in the top-left corner of the table, and then drag the right circle to the cell at the bottom-right corner. This will select all the cells within the table.

steps.title: Tap Home.
steps.content: Tap Home . If you don't see the menu, tap the icon of the A in front of a pencil.

steps.title: Tap Table.
steps.content: Tap Table . This will be at the very bottom of the list.

steps.title: Tap Convert to Range.
steps.content: Tap Convert to Range . The table will be converted into a range of data. You can now remove the formatting.

steps.title: Tap Home.
steps.content: Tap Home . You may have been redirected to this tab.

steps.title: Tap Clear.
steps.content: Tap Clear . This will be towards the bottom of the Home tab.

steps.title: Tap Clear Formats.
steps.content: Tap Clear Formats . The table's formatting will be removed. You can also use Excel to make graphs, lists, and forms .
